body: Can you walk through the debugger and check why the warning is happening? What is mistaken in our assumptions?

issue.title: warn user when using minified code outside of NODE_ENV 'production'

repository.name: redux
repository.description: A JS library for predictable global state management

issue.body:
@gaearon my attempt at #1029 . Likely still needs a bit of work but I wanted to get your opinion before i continued. thanks!

![screen shot 2015-11-26 at 12 35 14 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8263298/11415808/a4d9e23a-93d5-11e5-83db-593969291ab5.png)

body: Thanks for the quick work. Commit  b1bcee2 was likely sufficient to not crash the app when the console isn't open, which is really all I need for ie9 :smile:.
Good evening: Question, I am not using webpack, but I am getting that error in Chrome. Could you please help me?
@richardvaldiviesomacias What do you use to bundle CommonJS modules? You can only get this warning (it’s not technically an error) with CommonJS.
Thanks for your quick answer. I am using Browserify.

Does the part of the warning related to browserify help?

> You are currently using minified code outside of NODE_ENV === 'production'. This means that you are running a slower development build of Redux. **You can use loose-envify (https://github.com/zertosh/loose-envify) for browserify** or DefinePlugin for webpack (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/30030031) to ensure you have the correct code for your production build.
I notice that I have that package. Question, I have redux version 3.0.5 is that a problem?

I’m not sure I understand what you are asking. If you see this warning, please make sure you envify Redux in production. Normally putting `NODE_ENV=production` before your `browserify` call should be enough for this. As a last resort you can use prebuilt UMD build in `redux/dist/redux.min.js`. It doesn’t need envification. I hope this helps.
Thanks @gaearon I will try your advice. This is my first big project using React and Redux, so still learning. Definitely became my libraries of choice.

I'm using browserify with `loose-envify` transform after babel and I'm setting `process.env.NODE_ENV = 'production';` before bundling modules and still get this warrning in all Browsers.

Tried also with `envify` package and setting NODE_ENV in global scope.

I'm on Redux 3.6.0.

**Update:**
logging `process.env.NODE_ENV` to browser console inside _isCrushed_ dummy function returns `undefined` however logging `process.env` only it returns an Object`{ NODE_ENV: 'production' }`.

Obviously the envify passes in the environment var ok but I'm a bit confused as to what actually is happening here.

**Update2:**
Problem was, that process.env object in terminal was evaluated at real-time, when it actually wasn't yet populated before the _isCrushed_ function was called. I was setting up the transforms for browserify incorrectly, so here's a solution:

Instead of setting up the transforms for browserify by passing in the array of transform functions pass them as arrays of functions and envify/loose-envify transform as a string with options:

```
browserify({transform:[
          [babelify],
          ['envify', {NODE_ENV:'production'}],
          [resolvify]
]})
```

The documentation how to properly format the transform option for browserfiy to be able to pass in options to transforms is very sparse thus I'm dropping this here for anyone that may stumble upon it.

@mrdulin : that's the output of the build process, after `process.env.NODE_ENV` has been replaced with another value.  I've got an article here that explains what's going on: http://blog.isquaredsoftware.com/2016/11/posts-on-packtpub-generic-redux-modals-and-building-better-bundles/ .

@markerikson Thanks. So, my `webpack` config `alias` maybe: 
```js
redux: path.join(nodeModulePath, env === 'development' ? `redux/dist/redux.js` : 'redux/dist/redux.min.js'),
```
?

issue.title: Update dependency react-redux to v4.4.10
issue.body:
[![Mend Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com)

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| [react-redux](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux) | [`4.0.0` -> `4.4.10`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/react-redux/4.0.0/4.4.10) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/react-redux/4.4.10/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/react-redux/4.4.10/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/react-redux/4.4.10/compatibility-slim/4.0.0)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/react-redux/4.4.10/confidence-slim/4.0.0)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>reduxjs/react-redux</summary>

### [`v4.4.10`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.4.10)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.4.9...v4.4.10)

-   Update hoist-non-react-statics to 3.x

### [`v4.4.9`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.4.9)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.4.8...v4.4.9)

-   Update hoist-non-react-statics to 2.x

### [`v4.4.8`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.4.8)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.4.7...v4.4.8)

-   Fix deprecation warnings with React 15.5.0 ([#​666](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/issues/666) 🤘 by [@​Calyhre](https://togithub.com/Calyhre))

### [`v4.4.7`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.4.7)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.4.6...v4.4.7)

-   Allow React 16 as peerDependency ([#​660](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/issues/660) by [@​gaearon](https://togithub.com/gaearon))

### [`v4.4.6`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.4.6)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.4.5...v4.4.6)

-   Update React peer dependency to allow React 15.4.0 RC

### [`v4.4.5`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.4.5)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.4.4...v4.4.5)

-   Fixes a regression introduced in 4.4.4 where cleaning up the state in parent’s `componentWillUnmount` caused an error in child’s `mapStateToProps` ([#​351](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/issues/351), [`ea53d6f`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/commit/ea53d6fb076359a864a1d543568d951d4b3eab3d))

### [`v4.4.4`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.4.4)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.4.3...v4.4.4)

-   Bail out of calling `setState()` when `mapStateToProps()` doesn’t care about `ownProps` ([#​348](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/issues/348), [#​300](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/issues/300))
-   (Even if it does, you might be able to benefit from this optimization—read [https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/pull/348](https://togithub.com/reactjs/react-redux/pull/348) for details)

### [`v4.4.3`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.4.3)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.4.2...v4.4.3)

-   State shape warning now has a more descriptive message ([#​335](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/issues/335), [#​309](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/issues/309))
-   State shape check is now a warning rather than a hard error, and is disabled in production for better performance ([`90f427b`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/commit/90f427bc3da274162d69dc336e3b8e94c3087b24))

### [`v4.4.2`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.4.2)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.4.1...v4.4.2)

-   Custom `mergeProps` now works correctly with components that have `pure: false` ([#​337](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/issues/337), [#​338](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/issues/338))

### [`v4.4.1`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.4.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.4.0...v4.4.1)

-   React v15 is now allowed as a peer dependency ([#​317](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/issues/317), [#​319](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/issues/319))

### [`v4.4.0`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.4.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.3.0...v4.4.0)

-   Removes the broken `jsnext:main`. It is supposed to point to the ES module build but we mistakingly pointed it to the `src`, so it never worked for anyone anyway. For now, we don’t provide an ES module build in React Redux, so if you use Rollup, you need to use the CommonJS plugin for it. Realistically, it doesn’t make a big difference because React Redux assumes you use React anyway (which uses CommonJS), and it also doesn’t benefit from tree shaking because there are only two exports (`connect` and `<Provider>`) and you will need both pretty much any time.

This is a minor bump because we couldn’t break anybody with this (it was broken before), but it seems to deserve more than a patch bump as it’s a change in the build configuration.

### [`v4.3.0`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.3.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.2.1...v4.3.0)

-   Adds per-instance memoization API. If your `mapStateToProps` or `mapDispatchToProps` returns a function, *that* function will be used instead for the given component instance. Most apps never need this, but it can be handy for custom memoization logic in apps with large component trees. It can bring significant performance improvements when used together with Reselect. ([#​279](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/issues/279), [`7ee928b`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/commit/7ee928b23ea0ad15e22b51d7d4aff5eb1a0f95b5), [#​179](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/issues/179))

### [`v4.2.1`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.2.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.2.0...v4.2.1)

-   Bump Lodash to 4.2.0 ([rackt/redux#​1346](https://togithub.com/rackt/redux/issues/1346), [rackt/redux#​1349](https://togithub.com/rackt/redux/issues/1349))

### [`v4.2.0`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.2.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.1.2...v4.2.0)

-   `isPlainObject` that we use internally is now outsourced to Lodash 4.1 ([rackt/redux#​1339](https://togithub.com/rackt/redux/issues/1339)). Note that this does not mean we depend on Lodash itself. We only use a tiny module from it. We also use the same module in Redux >= 3.2.0.

### [`v4.1.2`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.1.2)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.1.1...v4.1.2)

-   Don't depend on `console` or `console.error` ([https://github.com/rackt/redux/issues/1311](https://togithub.com/rackt/redux/issues/1311), https://github.com/rackt/react-redux/commit/208efae97b59c39930533c6b3825a23f6f3d4b33)
-   Remove warning from the production builds (https://github.com/rackt/react-redux/commit/208efae97b59c39930533c6b3825a23f6f3d4b33)

### [`v4.1.1`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.1.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.1.0...v4.1.1)

-   Adds `loose-envify` as a dependency to fix builds for Browserify users. ([#​1304](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/issues/1304) & [#​1306](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/issues/1306))

### [`v4.1.0`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.1.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.0.6...v4.1.0)

-   For Browserify users, Redux should now be properly envified without extra configuration ([#​274](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/issues/274))

### [`v4.0.6`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.0.6)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.0.5...v4.0.6)

-   Fixes a regression on IE8. ([https://github.com/rackt/react-redux/issues/232](https://togithub.com/rackt/react-redux/issues/232), [https://github.com/rackt/react-redux/issues/233](https://togithub.com/rackt/react-redux/issues/233), https://github.com/rackt/react-redux/commit/caae2e1d53775b89716683f7d6a5d8302cad5a87, https://phabricator.babeljs.io/T2817)

### [`v4.0.5`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.0.5)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.0.4...v4.0.5)

-   Avoids unnecessary recalculation of props for components that don't specify `mapStateToProps` (https://github.com/rackt/react-redux/commit/6c504b966839be0e739d5a566c8fb844c27a6c44#commitcomment-15145082, https://github.com/rackt/react-redux/commit/04693ca0cabe021b27b62eb9240b51459ffe8c32)

### [`v4.0.4`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.0.4)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.0.3...v4.0.4)

-   Avoids use of `Object.defineProperty()` to prevent errors in IE8 ([https://github.com/rackt/react-redux/issues/227](https://togithub.com/rackt/react-redux/issues/227))

### [`v4.0.3`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.0.3)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.0.2...v4.0.3)

-   Fixes a bug that caused the props of connected components to not updated during a hot update with something like React Hot Loader. Internally, it involved moving the memoized calculations from `shouldComponentUpdate()` into more appropriate places such as `componentWillReceiveProps()`, `handleChange()`, and `render()`. ([https://github.com/rackt/react-redux/issues/224](https://togithub.com/rackt/react-redux/issues/224), [https://github.com/rackt/react-redux/pull/225](https://togithub.com/rackt/react-redux/pull/225))

### [`v4.0.2`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.0.2)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.0.1...v4.0.2)

-   Fixes a bug that caused `mapStateToProps` to be called twice instead of just once before the component is mounted. ([https://github.com/rackt/react-redux/pull/196](https://togithub.com/rackt/react-redux/pull/196))

### [`v4.0.1`](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v4.0.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/reduxjs/react-redux/compare/v4.0.0...v4.0.1)

-   Removes `.babelrc` in the compiled package because it is irrelevant (we ship ES5 code) and breaks React Native 0.16 and some consumers who use Babel 6 forgetting to exclude `node_modules` from transformations. ([https://github.com/rackt/react-redux/pull/213](https://togithub.com/rackt/react-redux/pull/213), [https://github.com/rackt/redux/issues/1033](https://togithub.com/rackt/redux/issues/1033), [https://github.com/rackt/redux/issues/1039](https://togithub.com/rackt/redux/issues/1039), [https://github.com/rackt/redux/issues/1127](https://togithub.com/rackt/redux/issues/1127))

</details>
